text: <@U2H3TT8F2> you can add custom og meta to the head html <http://pepperlandmarketing.com/blog/how-to-add-social-tags-to-your-HubSpot-landing-pages/>

Correct. But can it be done programatically? For example on the page, if you have a HubL variable, you wont be able to grab that variable and place it in the html head before the pages loads without doing it manually or creating a custom page option that the user would have to fill in all the time

I have javascript on the page and the value returned from it is what I am trying to place in the header. Likewise, if I were to add another `og:description` tag, then there would be 2 `og:description` tags in the header as HubSpot by default adds the `title, description, og:title,` and `og:description` tags

Looks like it may be possible if you place the HubL in the header of the template. This is reference to an og image tag but it should be the same for a description. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/COS-Design-Support/HubL-in-Head-og-image-tag/td-p/7802>
